lj.lj_ls: 保健服务行业从业人员以其忠于职守的态度而显得与众不同。

lj.lj_ls: 正在淡出人们视野的前辈政治家。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  brēdan 'produce (offspring), bear (a child'), of Germanic origin; related to German brüten, also to brood

entry.def: A breed of a pet animal or farm animal is a particular type of it. For example, terriers are a breed of dog.

example.ex: Certain breeds are more dangerous than others.
example.tran: 某些品种比其他品种更危险。

entry.def: If you breed animals or plants, you keep them for the purpose of producing more animals or plants with particular qualities, in a controlled way.

example.ex: He lived alone, breeding horses and dogs...
example.tran: 他独自一人生活，饲养马匹和狗。

example.ex: He used to breed dogs for the police...
example.tran: 他曾经为警方培育警犬。

entry.def: When animals breed, they have babies.

example.ex: Frogs will usually breed in any convenient pond...
example.tran: 通常青蛙会在任何条件适宜的池塘中繁殖。

example.ex: The area now attracts over 60 species of breeding birds.
example.tran: 这一地区现在吸引了60多种鸟类到此繁育后代。

entry.def: If you say that something breeds bad feeling or bad behaviour, you mean that it causes bad feeling or bad behaviour to develop.

example.ex: If they are unemployed it's bound to breed resentment...
example.tran: 如果他们失去工作，一定会产生怨恨。

entry.def: You can refer to someone or something as one of a particular breed of person or thing when you want to talk about what they are like.

example.ex: Sue is one of the new breed of British women squash players who are making a real impact...
example.tran: 休是英国新一代的女子壁球运动员，她们的影响正在显现出来。

example.ex: The new breed of walking holidays puts the emphasis on enjoyment, not endurance...
example.tran: 这种新型的徒步旅行假日重在愉悦身心，而不是为了锻炼耐力。

entry.def: Someone who was born and bred in a place was born there and grew up there.

example.ex: I was born and bred in the highlands...
example.tran: 我在高地地区出生和长大。

example.ex: Born and bred in this country, he and his wife emigrated to Los Angeles after the war...
example.tran: 尽管生于斯长于斯，他和妻子在战后还是移民去了洛杉矶。

means.word_mean: 2. a special variety of domesticated animals within a species;

sentences.sentence: "he experimented on a particular breed of white rats"
"he created a new strain of sheep"

means.word_mean: 3. half-caste offspring of parents of different races (especially of white and Indian parents)
4. a lineage or race of people
2. copulate with a female, used especially of horses;

auth_sentence.content: We don't have time to breed better humans.
auth_sentence.res_content: We don't have time to breed better humans.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We don't have time to breed better humans.

auth_sentence.content: Michael Carrick is a rare breed in English football.
auth_sentence.res_content: Michael Carrick is a rare breed in English football.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Michael Carrick is a rare breed in English football.

auth_sentence.content: So this is the breed we had last night?
auth_sentence.res_content: So this is the breed we had last night?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: So this is the breed we had last night?

Sentence.sentence: Failure more often than not breeds success.
They may breed out of control.

sentences.en: It makes her furious to see a good breed of sheep being treated cruelly.
sentences.cn: 看到品种优良的羊受到残忍的对待, 她非常气愤。

sentences.en: She bred her daughter to become a statesman.
sentences.cn: 她把她的女儿培养为一名政治家。

sentences.en: The parents are trying to breed their son a musician.
sentences.cn: 这对父母尽力要把儿子培养成为音乐家。

sentences.en: Flies in food shops breed disease.
sentences.cn: 食品店里的苍蝇能引起疾病。

jushi.english: The winning horse was bred in Ireland.
jushi.chinese: 获胜的马是在爱尔兰繁殖的。
